intro: Anthospermum welwitschii, commonly known as the African star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, dark blue berries. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
